author: Miruna Ariadna
text:
They're great, until they steal your money and refuse to give it back. 
Only pay with Paypal or credit card!!! I can't stress this enough. 
I've sold multiple items and bought a lot, and everything was (almost) ok until now.
I bought an item almost 3 weeks ago. A week ago I receive a notification that the item arrived at their warehouse and was going through the process of being authenticated. After a week of going back and forth with customer service in order to find out when will the item be sent to me, they claim they actually never received the package from the seller and that the item is lost. I asked for a refund and they refused. They asked for my ID in order to open an investigation, which I told them I will not provide, because that's between them and the seller, I have no part in that. They never explained why they need my ID, since the shipping company that supposedly lost the package only had the seller and their information. Why is MY personal private info needed??? I now see this is a common abuse they do. 
I asked multiple times for a refund, they refused each time. So basically they stole my money. 
I opened a claim with Paypal and now waiting. 
A similar thing happened a couple of years ago when a seller never sent the item and they refused to issue a refund and told me I have to wait 30+ days in order to get my money back. I had Paypal step it and got my money back. 
Only shop with them knowing these things happen and take all precautions. Having a 3rd party purchase protection is a must!
title: Only pay with Paypal

author: Stephanie

text:

text:

author: Liv R
text:
I have purchased a couple of things from Vestiaire in the past and, although slow to deliver the items, it went pretty smoothly. However I recently purchased a Burberry trench coat for £215 and it has been an appalling experience right the way through. The coat was listed as being located in the UK where I am - I had specifically only looked at items in the UK both to avoid duty / fees and also as I didn't want long shipping distances from an environmental perspective. After 2 weeks the coat still hadn't arrived, so I took a look at the tracking on the website. I then saw that the coat was now saying it was located at Vestiaire France not in the UK as it has been previously. I contacted Vestiaire on 3 occasions and provided photos of their website showing the coat listing had said it was in the UK. I told them explicitly that I would not pay any duty on the item given that the location had either changed, or had been falsely represented in the first place. Their customer services team ignored the evidence provided and just kept telling me I may be liable for duty charges.

What's worse is when the coat eventually arrived 18 days later it was reeking of damp and literally covered in mould! It had been described on the listing as being 'Perfect' and in 'Very Good' condition. Yet it is literally unwearable. The 'UK12' coat I had purchased was also the equivalent of about a UK 20 with a bust measurement of 51 inches instead of 39 inches. 

This is despite me paying Vestiaire additional money to authenticate the coat and undertake quality checks to make sure it complied with the information in the listing. 

I am absolutely furious about this. I have provided Vestiaire with photos to demonstrate the issues, but based on my experience to date who knows if they will actually acknowledge their errors and refund my money. I will update this review to confirm.
title: Worst experience with Vestiaire - item NOT as described at all

author: Maz
text:
Firstly, I don't enjoy leaving bad reviews and I feel every business deserves some grace. Secondly, this is the second time I have had to leave a review because it seems to be the only way to get somewhere with this company! You just had a billion dollars worth of funding....spend it on customer service!!!
I can't fathom luxury goods and the fees you charge and having customer service that can't answer simple questions, not a lux experience at all.  
I got an email stating I need to cancel my premium or it will be renewed for a fee. I literally asked customer service this months ago (August) and was told my product is a one off and it won't renew. 
I go into my account, try to figure out how to cancel and can't, its not listed on anything (I tried app and desktop) so I email customer service. Bear in mind this is after speaking to someone on chat who said "your product won't renew don't worry". 
I opted to contact and get double confirmation because I have dealt with VC customer service a few times and they are usually polite but completely uninformed. I got an email back today "unfortunately you can't cancel its less than 10 days-it cancels in 3 weeks. He couldn't be bothered to double my information before sending an email. Beyond frustrating dealing with this company. Cancel my premium!! I would do it myself if I could. 
All this being said, the Premium product itself isn't bad but dealing with the company when I need something is maddening, final straw for me.

UPDATE: 16 emails later I was able to find it in the desktop site and unsubscribe. This is my second really lousy VC experience. I was sent a fake bag months back and haven't purchased a thing since. I was not expecting to be enrolled in an auto renewing service without notice and was hoping to never have to deal with their snobby, rude customer service ever again. The customers and their submissions are your product, your fees are ridiculous and your service is subpar. Serious changes are needed.
title: I give up

author: Consumer
text:
Hopeless. Do not trust their authentication and checking service. I bought a wallet said to be in good condition and it was ‘checked’. it arrived and was a mess, exterior leather wearing off, colour faded, not good enough for the jumble sale. I queried this and they said the wear was visible on the seller’s photographs - it wasn’t. So poor quality items can be sold as good and the buyer has no recourse. Of course, I could resell it but don’t want con another customer as I have been conned. 
eBay is much better at customer service, transparency and responsiveness. Truly hopeless.
title: Hopeless

author: Dear Mr Odusanya
text: A THOROUGHLY DISHONEST COMPANY. I would have given a zero star, but the system does not allow this. I bought a trouser listed on the website as size 44 F (France) Mens size which Vestiaire listed as equivalent to 36 or XL in UK size which is my size. When I got the item, my leg couldn't even fit into the trouser. I could only assume that it was either a woman size or the size listing on the item was misleading. I have always use XL or 36 waist when buying either online or from shops with no issues whatsoever. I asked for a refund of my money and Vestiaire kept telling me it can only relist the item. I informed them that I can't relist an item that was listed with a misleading information.  I have contacted them several times and they keep sending same message. I wish I had read the reviews here before patronising this fraudulent company. More annoyingly the company did not even post the response to the seller regarding my complaint meaning they have no duty of care for their customers.
title: A THOROUGHLY DISHONEST COMPANY

text:
AVOID BUYING FROM THEM. THEY DON'T REFUND YOU ANYTHING IF THE SELLER LIES IN THE LISTING

author: Jelena
text:
I don’t leave bad reviews usually because I think every business/store/professional deserves a second or even third chance but I can’t not to in case of Vestiaire. I have sold a couple of items recently and all of a sudden I get an email saying I need to verify my identity or I cannot be paid (mind that I had already sent the items and they have been accepted and all). I have used Vestiaire for a couple of years now (since 2017 if I’m not mistaken) and suddenly now they need to verify that I’m… well… me. I didn’t question it at all and went on the app to fill out the forms I need to fill out until the last part where it showed error. I have tried countless times, on the app, on my desktop, I even deleted and downloaded the app again, nothing helps. Always the same error. I have contacted customer service three times. Useless. They just tell me they have sent the matter forward to their IT or whomever and that I should refresh the app with 24 hours. This was a week ago. Still the same error, still not paid for my sales. No money, no items. Awful.


Update: As you can see I was right about leaving the review. Instead of admitting the faulty system I get a reply that I don’t agree with Identity verification process. Where have I written that I don’t agree or understand the process?! I have nothing against it. I have even tried several time to do it but failed because of the faulty sistem/interface and/or unhelpful/useless/unexistant customer service.
title: I don’t leave bad reviews usually…
